newsitem.title: UK: NWE high sulphur fuel holds sharply higher.
newsitem.headline: NWE high sulphur fuel holds sharply higher.

text.p: High sulphur cargoes were significantly higher on Thursday on the back of tight avails and a deal done at $104.50 cif NWE.
On Wednesday a cargo was sold at $96 cif NWE.
Traders said the market was very finely balanced - an extra cargo or enquiry could shift the sector either way.
After the early trade high sulphur cargoes settled a touch lower around $103-105 cif NWE, but few dealers saw any enquiries for August material.
"It is tight, but the tightness has been extenuated," said one trader who asked where the demand was now.
Utility end-user interest was not seen, although some dealers said they expected an increase for September material.

High sulphur barges gained but not with the same vigour as cargoes. Barges traded at $100 fob ARA several times and $100.50 was the peak, but prices slipped narrowly to $98-99. Barges were not particuarly active, dampened in part by slow bunkering.
Low sulphur cracked cargoes consolidated gains made earlier in the week, but no trade was heard. Demand in NWE was absent and cargo avails were restricted to "bits and bobs," according to one broker.
